catalog_info.title: Global Geophysics: A Primer
catalog_info.notes: Formerly offered as EPS 52. Students who have taken EPS 52 cannot take EPS 152 for credit.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Applied Mathematics 21a,b (or Mathematics 1a,1b; or Mathematics 21a,b); Physics 11a,b (no longer offered) or Physics 15a,b (prior or concurrent) or Physical Sciences 12a,b; or permission of the instructor.
catalog_info.description: A comprehensive introduction to global geophysics. This course serves as a bridge between introductory Earth science courses (EPS 21, EPS 22) and higher level courses in EPS. Topics include: plate tectonics, the Earth's composition, thermal state and rheology, mantle convection, the geodynamo, the Earth's gravity field and geodesy, comparative planetology, and (modern and paleo) climate change.
